intro: Phelpsiella ptericaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed phelpsiella, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. The plant features finely divided, feather-like leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, which is a common trait among members of its family. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
